message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with distributed implementations of gradient-based methods, which are commonly studied in the areas of information theory (cs.IT), distributed computing (cs.DC), and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of coding theory to mitigate stragglers is a key aspect of the paper, which makes it relevant to the subfield of coding theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the challenge of tackling stragglers in massive-scale elastic and serverless systems, which falls under the domain of distributed systems (cs.DS) and control systems (cs.SY).
